summary: Admin panel testing completed with mixed results. Backend API 90.9% functional, frontend admin UI working well but with some access issues. Critical backend security vulnerability found.

critical_bugs.issue: Regular users can access admin endpoints - returns 200 instead of 403
critical_bugs.impact: Critical security vulnerability - unauthorized admin access

ui_bugs.issue: Admin button sometimes not visible for admin users in dashboard header

passed_tests: Admin login with fallstommy@gmail.com / admin123 works and returns role=admin
Admin stats panel shows correct counts (4 users, 2 active subs, 0 configs, 2 payments)
Admin page renders with proper tabs (Users, Configs, Equipment, Payments)
Users tab shows list of users with role and subscription information
Admin can update user roles via dropdown selection
Admin can grant/revoke subscriptions for users
Configurations tab displays all configs across users
Equipment tab shows equipment by category with add/delete functionality
Admin can add new equipment via dialog form with JSON validation
Payments tab shows payment transaction history
Admin panel navigation and back button functionality works
Unauthenticated access to /admin correctly redirects to auth page
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix backend authorization bug where regular users can access admin endpoints (/admin/stats, /admin/users return 200 instead of 403). Also investigate inconsistent admin button visibility in frontend navigation.
